reviewText: Very compelling lectures, saw on YouTube, but there is a LOT of hyperbole in these conspiracy theories. Although some of the material discussed is given with sourced cited, most is not - so it's unfortunately hard to sift the wheat from the chaff. I'm sure this man has some sort of evidence of wrongdoing by organizations and political figures, like big pharmacy and the various agencies entrusted with keeping us all safe - but it's just very hard to take in when he insists on throwing everything on the table with insufficient proofs. Could he be right? Sure, he could be at least partly right, but there's no way to really know how much of it is true.
